content: this is an accessible dyslexia friendly pattern which has been tech edited and tested **pattern description** the aisling hairband is a beginner friendly crochet pattern these hairbands work up quickly and are fun to make each hair band will take less than an hour to create and they are a brilliant stash buster you can use small leftover scraps for each circle with as many colours as you like make one to coordinate with a favourite outfit make a little pile as party favours or for market stall sales if planning on selling items made from this pattern please take a moment to read my copyright information at the end construction worked in interlinked circles techniques used easy beginner friendly stitches only uses us terms chain single_crochet double_crochet and slip_stitch to join rounds skill level beginner **materials required ** small amounts 2 5 meters per circle of worsted weight cotton yarn if following gauge or any yarn of your choice one hair elastic 4 5 mm crochet hook or size for your yarn substitution darning needle for weaving in ends **acessibility** written to british dyslexia association guidelines sans-serif font ample spacing no italics or block capitals no abbreviations used larger than standard font for neurodiverse and low vision accessibility photos are used to visually demonstrate each step all information in the photos is repeated in the text abbreviations free for easy reading and neurodiverse accessibility this pattern may not be fully screenreader accessible due to its blog formatting therefore a recording is embedded where the pattern has been read out loud in us terms by the designer
